climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging.

features: ALL-POWERFUL CLEAN: Clean isn’t just a state, it’s a feeling we facilitate. Just one half ounce of our powerful concentrated laundry detergent transforms your laundry, delivering crisp, clean clothes every time. One 32 oz carton washes 64 loads and is compatible with all machines and water temperatures.
TRIPLE ACTION FORMULA: Our sensitive skin-safe liquid laundry detergent battles on three fronts: fighting stains, removing odors and softening clothes to deliver crisp, clean clothes every time.

EARTH FRIENDLY PACKAGING: Reduce the use of single use plastic bottles with our plastic jug free packaging. Our laundry detergent soap is packed in a 100% recyclable paper-based carton and is made with 90% less plastic than traditional detergents.

A CLEANER KIND OF CULT: We only use the good stuff to keep your clothes clean and your family safe. Our laundry detergent liquid formulas are always made without phthalates, phosphates, petroleum based ingredients, dyes, SLS, & SLES. Never bear witness to stubborn stains and odors again.
SMELLS LIKE CLEAN SPIRIT: Lighten your load on laundry day with the heavenly scents of our laundry detergent. Our premium fragrances mark the accomplishment of a job well done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helps save plastic bottles while working great!
reviews.reviewText: I have a subscription to this and every time I get a new shipment, I simply pour them into an older Tide plastic bottle that I have saved. It might seem a little expensive, but I love the way it does not smell at all, is made of fairly clean ingredients, and does not use plastic. And I used the washer sheets for a while but was less happy with those - they never seemed to work well and I would use two or three at a time: very expensive. I am overall very happy with it and will keep getting it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works better than the big boys
reviews.reviewText: We love this detergent. The scent isn’t overwhelming at all (I cannot wear perfumes or strong scents at my job). It cleans our activewear with ease, and doesn’t leave any film/residue. Also love how little you need to be effective.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smells good and cleans well!
reviews.reviewText: I’m loving this detergent so far and have purchased Clean Cult in another scent also. The scent is not as strong as you may get from some of the mainstream detergent brands but you are avoiding the micro plastics and carcinogens that you get with those brands while still cleaning your clothes. I feel safer using Clean Cult and feel better about the impact on the environment by avoiding the big brands and will stick with Clean Cult from now on. I do think there may be some better packaging options out there though that are recyclable since in my area, as I’m guessing in many others, this wax-coated cardboard, is not recyclable. But it’s still better than a giant plastic tub. Also, it’s very thick and concentrated as you’re not buying the added water so the packages are small. It does pour more like molasses than the watery detergent you may be used to but this is a good thing!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Mostly I like it!
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this for a month now. If you use the right amount it is relatively economical and does the job. I even tested it on a soy sauce stain and it came out completely with a regular washing. The scent is interesting--as others have said an imitation lemon smell--however, if you thoroughly dry the items in a dryer, the smell goes away. I like to hang somethings to dry in the nicer weather and those things retain some of that odd scent. I bought the glass container sold for this product, and it makes it easy to measure the correct quantity and is not messy, like pouring from the carton would be. And I appreciate the lower waste aspect of the packaging. All in all, I like it, just not quite enough for the fifth star because of the residual smell if things aren't thoroughly dried.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good stuff, sustainable packaging
reviews.reviewText: This detergent works beautifully and comes in a readily recycleable container. Your choice of scents or unscented or extra-sensitive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Makes your laundry smell musty
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to like this products and I had heard many wonderful things regarding clean cult. I’m sure the unscented one is great, the performance…. It works great. It’s very cost-effective as you get a lot of product for a decent price but the specific smell let me tell you, maybe avoid it. I like that this product is nontoxic and made with clean ingredients but I just can’t get over the smell. The sandalwood I normally love but in this product it smells like straight dirt when you wash your clothes. ;( I’ve used it already a couple times thinking that maybe I would get used to it, but it still smells reminiscent of when you leave your laundry in the washer for too long and then throw it in the dryer…. GROSS. Always happens too, I always switch my laundry on time and never leave for too long all the loads washed with this smelled this way. even after I dry I normally like to use lavender essential oils on my wool dryer balls in the dryer for my scent, but I thought I would try a recommended scent because it had decent reviews. I wish I would’ve just bought unscented. ;( I went back to molly suds! Love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Is this magic? Maybe.
reviews.reviewText: I’ve used everything from target & Walmart, along with Hex, and a couple enzyme detergents from big box stores (yes, I used a lot of oxiclean too). I still have my fingers crossed, as humidity has a way of bringing life back to odors I thought I’d chased away, but I think this is the one. It feels like peak adulthood to find “the laundry detergent”. It doesn’t offend my skin (hi, easily offended). Washes out dog, teen, workout, night sweats, man. It smells really nice, even though it claims to smell like a balmy summer night, which sounds awful. I use it with Dirty Labs powder enzymes. Have I ever tried DL detergent? No. If you must know why, it’s bc I shop online in the dead of night when I’ve decided that tomorrow I’ll change everyone’s life with a new product, gadget, or service, and nighttime me has never wanted DL detergent, so it has never arrived on my doorstep. I am at her mercy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love the hat I’m not putting huge plastic jugs in our landfill
